Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Simple Trapeziectomy and Trapeziectomy with Ligament Reconstruction and Tendon Interposition for Trapeziometacarpal Joint Osteoarthritis

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 54 participants with painful trapeziometacarpal joint osteoarthritis were randomised

Participants.evidence: 54 participants with painful trapeziometacarpal joint osteoarthritis

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either simple trapeziectomy (n=25) or trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition (LRTI) (n=29)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate radiographic progression of degenerative joint disease, changes in pseudarthrosis height, and the association of degenerative changes with clinical outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Radiographic changes were assessed using the Kellgren and Lawrence system, and clinical outcomes were measured using the Patient Evaluation Measure (PEM), Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH) questionnaires, and thumb key pinch strength at 1-year and 6-year follow-ups.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 54 participants with painful trapeziometacarpal joint osteoarthritis were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: Increased degenerative changes were observed in 7/25 simple trapeziectomy cases and 1/29 LRTI cases.
